Name: Shabti of Petosiris
Description: This small funerary statuette was discovered in one of the necropoleis of Abydos during the excavations of W. F. Petrie. It belonged to the "prophet of Hathor" Petosiris, son of Djedher. The anepigraphic shabti is distinguished by a brilliant faience with a thick vitrified layer. The Museum of Brussels also preserves four other shabtis of the same person (E.0485A, C - E).
